title: Crash when writing acute accent/tick character on Rocky Linux 8
body:
Simply entering the `´` (acute accent/tick) character crashes alacritty 0.11.0 on Rocky Linux 8.6, but on alacritty 0.10.1 it works as expected. 

### System

OS: Linux (Rocky Linux 8.6)
Version: alacritty 0.11.0
Linux/BSD: Wayland, Compositor: mutter 3.32.2 and WM: GNOME Shell 3.32.2

### Logs

Crashes (with 'full' backtrace):
```BASH
thread 'main' panicked at 'byte index 1 is not a char boundary; it is inside '´' (bytes 0..2) of `´`', library/core/src/str/mod.rs:127:5
stack backtrace:
   0:     0x55b89278552d - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::libunwind::trace::h9135f25bc195152c
                               at /rustc/a55dd71d5fb0ec5a6a3a9e8c27b2127ba491ce52/library/std/src/../../backtrace/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:93:5
   1:     0x55b89278552d - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::trace_unsynchronized::h015ee85be510df51
                               at /rustc/a55dd71d5fb0ec5a6a3a9e8c27b2127ba491ce52/library/std/src/../../backtrace/src/backtrace/mod.rs:66:5
   2:     0x55b89278552d - std::sys_common::backtrace::_print_fmt::h5fad03caa9652a2c

   4:     0x55b8927acbac - core::fmt::write::h401e827d053130ed

   5:     0x55b8927811b1 - std::io::Write::write_fmt::hffec93268f5cde32
                               at /rustc/a55dd71d5fb0ec5a6a3a9e8c27b2127ba491ce52/library/std/src/io/mod.rs:1672:15
   6:     0x55b892786e85 - std::sys_common::backtrace::_print::h180c4c706ee1d3fb

Font/Terminal size: 
```
[0.000919707s] [DEBUG] [alacritty] Loading "monospace" font

Keyboard and bindings: I am not sure what to write here. I just saw a lot of render events and initially similair output as -vv. Edit: Output from --print-events
